info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Madison County through 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Marshall, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Mars Hill, Hot Springs, Walnut, Canto and Spring Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
